ES UN JUEGO INTERESANTE Y ENTRETENIDO

This was an excellent puzzle game, if a little a short. The brief time you spend in Aperture Laboratories (the game took about 2 hours, not going after achievements or straying from the main path at all) is full of both critical thinking and falling infinitely between two portals. Even if puzzles aren't usually your thing (I would know), this game can still be well worth the time and effort.
100% recomendable, me gusto bastante, el unico problema que le note es que es un juego bastante corto, creo que con un poco mas de niveles estaria perfecto
C'est devenu un classique auquel tout le monde devrait y jouer!
Jogo bem legal e facil pena que é bem pequeno voce termina ele em 3 horas , mas mesmo assim recomendo ;)
Très bon jeu, un classique ! A avoir absolument !

Good game, recommended for those who like puzzles and such, does run also on average rigs, it lacks replayability and a cooperative mode; there are only some challenges in addition to the main game.
Despite everything, I would still recommend it if on sale.
Out of all the puzzle games I've played this is the best one. The levels are good. The hazards are good. The enemies are good. I highly recommend this if you like puzzles games.

47/10

this game has everything it needs,i love how it takes place in the future and you can add anything with no comments saying "theres no way we were that advanced in 1984" and stuff like that,i love the unexpected plot and how it challlenges you,but i would like better scenery,the textures and animations are awesome,but it was missing stuff like large places,and nice-looking scenery (like colorful stuff,the whole game was really only black and white as for the walls,for other stuff,kinda the same,turrets are white and red,glodos is only black and white,ect.) so for a real rating,i give it a 9 and a half/10

Eu gostei do jogo mas esperava mais. Acho que de tudo que ouvi, esperava que fosse uma experiência mais intensa. Mas acabou sendo algo bacana, mas nada de "genial" como era vendido por alguns. Também não achei nada muito difícil, o que é bom, pois é na mediada certa.

	A mecânica com certeza é algo muito original, mas por mais incrível que parece, eu achei muito mal explorada. Acho que tinha possibilidades de brincar muito mais com os portais do que o que o jogo te apresenta. Tem alguns momentos legais, como alguns pulos mais altos e inesperados, mas no geral, achei mal explorado. A verdade é que me lembro de ter me divertido muito mais jogando o joguinho em Flash na época que saiu do que essa versão completa hoje. (pode ser que por eu ter jogado hoje e não na época, ainda mais depois de já ter brincado e explorado as mecânicas pelo jogo em flash, tenha perdido grande parte do impacto).

	O humor do jogo e a atmosfera é um ponto positivo e interessante, mas também não achei tão maravilhoso assim (espero mais do Portal 2 nesse sentido, pois ouvi melhores comentários).

	Não tive paciência, nem estômago - pois jogos em FPS me fazem passar muito mal se jogo muito mais que uns 30 min seguidos - pra jogar muito dos desafios. A maioria parece apenas repetitivo e não inventivo, como era o que eu esperava do jogo.

Nota: 6/10

Portal - Это интересная игра с головоломками в которых в помощь прийдет портальная пушка . Захватывающий сюжет , интересные уровни , правда графика подкачала , но я не любитель хорошей графики , поиграйте в эту игру и на графику станеть пофиг . Правда немного коротковатая я прошел ее за 2 часа,но все же получил много впечатлений . Очень интересная последняя битва...... Ладно не буду спойлерить) Моя оценка не смотря на графику 10 из 10

Do I need to write a review? No. It's good, play it for once. It's not a game to be enjoyed, but rather to remember played. To write a review for Portal is like writing a review for Garry's Mod. It's pointless.

This is the first game I owned on Steam. It has been one of my favorite games to play. Its puzzles are unlike any other game (except Portal 2). People say that you only get 2-3 hours on this game, but if you are like me and you are bad at puzzles, you can get more than 5. If you don't remember things well, you can go back and play this game over again. 

Portal is not a very hard puzzle game, which is good for people like me, but if you want a harder game, get Portal 2

Portal is a good game and I think you should play this game before you play portal 2 because it's like a tutorial. After playing this game you get an understanding of what they actually game is like. You learn how to solve puzzles and use the portal gun. The graphic is great since the game is from 2007 and the backstory in the game is awesome.

8/10
Might be a short game but definitly worth any cent :D

I loved this game. Well where to get started so I love a good brain game and portal is a huge puzzle game that you have to constantly adapt your thinking so you can get through the stages. My only criticism would be that it was a pretty short game. I beat it in about 3 hours but it was 3 hours of fun. So if you like puzzle games that make you alter your thinking its definately worth it. I got it on sale along with Portal 2 for $6.24 and it was completely worth it

Zasiadając do tej gry miałem mieszane uczucia. Z jednej strony- wielki respekt do Valve za wymyślenie tej całej mechaniki, świata i w ogóle. Z drugiej strony- gra ma już 7 lat i nie spodziewałem się fajerwerków na moim monitorze :) Ale gra postanowiła mnie zaskoczyć, co dobre, na plus i co lepsze, aż tak mocno. Grafika ustawiona na max- wygląda ładnie, tylko przy szybkim obracaniu widokiem widać brak antyaliasingu i widać pixelozę, ale to takie małe nic w sumie. Muzyka jest miodna, buduję nastrój, atmosferę strachu, niepewności i powiem szczerze, że bałem się bardziej w Portalu niż w Amnesii ;) Gameplay i fabuła również na +. Jednym słowem- kawałek dobrej zabawy. No właśnie, kawałek, bo gra jest bardzo krótka, aż chciałoby się jeszcze kilka łamigłówek więcej :(  
Ocena: 8,5/10  -------> krótka i te bugi graficzne na -
amazing game this is the best single player game i ahve played
ИГРА КЛАССНАЯ РАЗВИВАЕТ ЛОГИКУ
GoodGame
Great game! Very unique concept, unlike any other game that I personally play. Strategic and a great story line. Would recommend, especially for the price. Very short game however.

[h1] Un clásico moderno [/h1]
Este es uno de mis juegos favoritos. La primera vez que lo jugué fue en The Orange Box, donde lo incluían como un "experimento" para rellenar un fantástico paquete con los Half-Life 2 y Team Frotress 2.
Pero desde el primer momento enamora. No eres el protagonista del juego (la protagonista más bien), eres solo un elemento para conocer a GLaDoS, la robot que domina el complejo de Aperture Science, y que aporta lo que enamora a todo el mundo de Portal: ese humor inteligente, de constantes pullitas hacia tí, pero no tan descaradas como las de Portal 2. A ese humor le añades la novedad que fue en su momento, y que incluso sigue siendo, de los portales.
Realmente, aunque es un juego corto, es muy disfrutable de principio a fin.
Si un juego sigue siendo moderno 7 años después de su salida, sigue influyendo tanto, es porque es bueno. Amigos, Portal es el Half-Life de la década del 2000. Compradlo y disfrutad.
Y no olvideis, [b] think with portals[/b].
Amazing game.

Portal was absolutely sublime. I mean, this was fantastic.
I can't think of any major criticisms. I liked the lengths they went to to show how GLaDOS devolves through the game, until eventually, you... I'm not going to spoil it for you.
I finished it in two and a half hours, you really have nothing to lose! If you can, get it in the bundle with Portal 2, because you WILL want more once you're done. The game's so simplistic and elegant. Quite challenging, too.
Get this game.

Сама по себе игра неплоха, есть шутки над которыми действительно можно посмеяться. Графика для 2007 вполне приятная, да и сейчас смотрится неплохо. Единственное, чего практически нет в игре — нормального сюжета. Вы просто проходите 2 десятка комнат с головоломками (над половиной из которых нужно действительно думать, а не просто кнопки нажимать), а в конце проходите босса, который, по сути, тоже сплошная головоломка. Есть забавные отсылки, секретки (которые на самом деле очень легко заметить). 
Моя оценка 8/10, игра хороша.

Laugh like a mad man in the middle of the night when GLaDOS said that.
um dos melhores puzzles, que já vi, muito interativo e com uma história por trás dos puzzles, vc não joga apenas para testar sua capacidade, o que fez do jogo um sucesso!
Awesome game. You should play this AND Portal 2 for the best gameplay experience ever!

This review is for Portal and Portal 2:

I have never been phased by anything of the horror genre. Creepy-crawly spiders or shadowy forms moving just outside your field of view seemed too contrived and blunt to ever be frightening. Worst case scenario, they kill you. Oh no, not death, that thing we all have to face eventually anyway! Maybe bodily harm? Ideally I'd like to not be in pain, but skinning my knee doesn't exactly give me nightmares. What really gets to me is the sort of subtle, believable, and relatable psychological oppression nicely exemplified by Portal. 
To start off, GLaDos has this way of seamlessly mixing truth with fiction so that you have no idea what is going on. Is the world really up there waiting for you? Are you underground? Are you really adopted? Who are you? What are we testing for?This is worsened by the fact that every test chamber looks the same and once you start portaling you can't tell which side of the room is really the floor and which is the ceiling: almost vertigo inducing disorientation. All the turrets seem to feel pain both physical and emotional and say "Are you still there", "I don't hate you", in a cooing voice as you kill them. GLaDos might feel pain too, the companion cube might love you? It's all unclear. The lines between human, zombie, and computer are always up for debate. All the while, Chell is slowly drained of her humanity. This blurry "half life" state (you see what they did there right?) is a guiding theme of the the Portal and aptly named Half-Life series. The Schodinger's cat motiff of portal (zombie cat dead and alive) is most poignant in Portal 2 when you hear the companion cube singing (are you going insane?) and it sounds like the mews of a cat a little. A cat trapped in between life and death mewing a cheerful song to pass the time. I don't know, maybe I'm being a bit melodramatic. But this is the only type of "horror a la Valve" that resonates with me.
 On every level from the visceral to the metaphysical this already struck a chord with me. None of the individual test chamber were too challenging, except for one of the advanced challenge chambers, but after marathoning through all the puzzles I could actually feel Chell's mental and physical exhaustion and really did just want to lay down in grass somewhere outside of Aperture and forget about science. By Portal 2, Valve had mastered the situation where you aren't quite sure whether to laugh a lot, or in fact be quite sad. The ending scene of Portal 2 was especially either heartwrenching or hillarious... I'm still not quite sure which (The Cara Mia turret opera), especially when translated from Italian to english. Of course this is not to say I didn't enjoy the game. In fact, Portal 2 is my second favorite game (I suppose Portal is 3rd), next to Half-Life. That I was made to feel Chell's psychological torment despite the fact that I was having the time of my life figuring out the portal mechanics is testament to the depth and care put into this game. 
Now for the part that most people associate with the game: the portal mechanics. Obviously I was quite enthralled by the quality of the Valve physics engine. Yes, momentum is conserved between portals, though I could have told you that without testing because the portal jumps are translationally invarient. I can also tell you that angular momentum and energy are conserved between portals because they preserved rotational symmetry and time symmetry respectively. Even charge and more exotic quantities would be conserved because of certain portal symmetries I observed. See what I'm saying, there's no point in me gushing over the physics engine because it's obvious that someone like me will enjoy themselves. I must say though, that Valve's use of the jump-then-press-crouch technique is one of the greatest physics engine innovations of all time. In the second advanced challenge chamber when I had to make Chell curl into a ball so her center of gravity was high enough to make the jump, I was quite impressed with the sophistication of the engine.

If you don't have time to read all that...it was good...play it.
not as good as portal 2 but still is very fun and awesome

最近やった中では一番の面白かったゲームです。
やるなら２も合わせてやりましょう。

大まかな内容は、主人公が”ポータルガン”という撃った壁や床や天井にワープする穴ができるアイテムを駆使して、
コンピュータお姉さんが出題するテストをクリアしていくというものです。

ジャンルとしては”アクションパズル”だそうですが、一人称視点のパズルです。

パズルとしてかなりよくできていて、難易度も徐々に上がっていくので初見でも問題なく楽しめました。
後半はかなりやり応えがあります。
しかしただ難しいだけでなくプレイヤーを飽きさせない演出や工夫が多々あり、プレイ中はどっぷりのめり込めました。

ストーリー性も、本作だけなら「へー、おもしろい」と思うだけでだったのですが、
続けて２もやると何倍も面白くなることでしょう。

ストーリーをクリアして、まだ喰い足りない方のためにもチャレンジモードがあります。
本編の難関をさらに難しくしたものと、それのタイムアタックがいくつかあります。
これは本当に難しいのですが、クリアした時の達成感は格別でしょう。（タイムアッタックはやってませんが・・・・・・）


最後に、”ポータル”で一番気に入ったところは、「コンピュータお姉さんの声」です。
”GLaDOS”という名前ですが、とても耳あたりのいい声で話しかけてくれます（大半が皮肉になりますが）。
また、タレットもかわいいです。タレットのフィギュアがほしいです。

ネタバレになるのでこれ以上は申しませんが、私はグラドスたんのおかげで２クリア後にサントラを尼でポチりました。
グラたんの歌うエンディングは1・2ともにお気に入りですｗ
ちなみに２のサントラは公式サイトで無料配信されているので、興味がある方はどうぞ・・・・・・。

Это самая потярсающая игра из всех, которые мне довелось встретить на жизненном пути, с захватывающей идеей и гениальнейшим исполнением.
Восхитительная атмосфера с сочетанием эмоционального напряжения, сопереживания и чертовски жизненного юмора!
Превосходный, глубоко звучащий саундтрек, который дополняет игру и еще более насыщает процесс прохождения.
Альтернативная реальность, в которую действительно начинаешь верить, пока все больше адаптируешься под удивительную механику игры и сближаешься с главной героиней. И язык уже не поворачивается отнести игру к жанру "фантастика", потому что герои и сюжет заставляют погрузиться в этот мир целиком.
Ну и, конечно же, вкуснейший тортик:)
